author: Staff Reporter
text:
Established at a cost of over Rs. 2 crore under self-sufficiency scheme

The commissioning of the synthetic court is expected to come as a boon to sports enthusiasts in Tiruchi. — PHOTO: A. MURALITHARAN

With enthusiasm writ large on their faces, youngsters practised at the synthetic courts under the watchful eyes of their coach at the tennis complex in Anna Stadium here.

The complex, which has been established at a cost of over Rs. 2 crore under the Self Sufficiency Scheme, was brought to public use recently.

“We have been eager to play on these synthetic courts. The facility is good and we feel motivated,” said Sherwin Isaac, a schoolboy and one of the trainees.

The tennis complex houses three flood-lit synthetic courts and galleries that can accommodate around 1,000 spectators.

The pavilion in the complex has a VIP gallery, dressing rooms for players and an office room. The Anna Stadium has a couple of clay courts as well.

Tiruchi has been hosting ITF (International Tennis Federation) men’s Futures tennis championship for the past four years on the clay courts at Union Club. Tennis enthusiasts feel that with the setting up of the new facility, the city can host an ITF tournament during the hard court season.
title: Synthetic tennis courts enthuse youth
